theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as signaling molecules inducing adaptive stress responses and hormesis, distinct from purely damaging ROS theories.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes in vivo mitochondrial hydrogen peroxide increase and ROS-driven signaling contributing to aging, fitting ROS signaling and hormesis theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS as drivers of senescence and aging, with focus on ROS signaling and targeted antioxidant interventions.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on balance of mitochondrial ROS production and antioxidant defenses influencing aging and longevity, emphasizing ROS signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Hormesis Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, impaired quality control (mitophagy, dynamics), hormonal interplay, and inflammation driving endometrial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Broad mitochondrial dysfunction including impaired dynamics, mitophagy, ROS, and inflammation as aging drivers, fitting mitochondrial dysfunction and quality control cluster.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitophagy impairment causing accumulation of damaged mitochondria, oxidative stress, and aging, fitting mitochondrial dysfunction and quality control cluster.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Genomic Instability Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on somatic mtDNA mutations accumulation, clonal expansion, and their impact on mitochondrial dysfunction and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Genomic Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related accumulation and clonal expansion of mtDNA deletions impairing mitochondrial function and physical performance.
